data.author: Wiseinvestor23
data.content: Https://www.linkedin.com/posts/nationalwealthfund_our-newstrategic-planpublished-today-activity-7422173123980046336-yVqz?utm_source=social_share_video_v2&utm_medium=android_app&rcm=ACoAADe2J_YBSBZUVuL6QadAXI43GtnMXw0_tnw&utm_campaign=copy_link 1. Unlocking growth opportunities on the pathway to clean energy by accelerating investment into the most critical projects, technologies and industries that enable decarbonisation and have the potential to lower bills for households and businesses. 2. Accelerating place-based investment across all four nations of the UK by providing financing and expert advice to regionally significant projects through the Regional Project Accelerator and investing in the enabling infrastructure to support regional growth. 3. Strengthening sovereign and strategic capabilities by investing in growth opportunities underpinning the UK’s national security, enabling UK leadership in industries of the future, and backing domestic supply chains for growth and resilience. This includes critical minerals, defence, green steel and AI. To achieve these ambitions, the National Wealth Fund will be adopting a more targeted approach, focusing on Industrial Strategy sectors and Infrastructure Strategy priorities, where it can make a real difference. The following 10 sectors have been identified where the Fund expects to have the most catalytic opportunities over the next five years: Ports & supply chains* Carbon capture, usage and storage* Hydrogen* Battery manufacturing & the electric vehicle supply chain* Steel* Power grid Energy storage Nuclear Transport infrastructure Place-based regenerati Energy Secretary Ed Miliband said: "Clean energy is not just about energy sovereignty, it is about bringing back the good industrial jobs that have been denied to our country for too long. Thanks to the certainty of the government's clean energy superpower mission and public investment like this - the industry is responding with record investment- meaning better jobs for people across our country." https://www.linkedin.com/posts/energypathways-plc_cleanenergy-netzero-renewables-activity-7404496356846882816-ndEF?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_android&rcm=ACoAADe2J_YBSBZUVuL6QadAXI43GtnMXw0_tnw

data.author: Wiseinvestor23
data.content: The most recent interview and Investors presentation for anyone who haven't seen them https://youtu.be/J3B2fc_NrDk?si=cyDKA5Dj7alVE4XR https://youtu.be/2YlOjJxvrMI?si=Q8a3BXn76-IeaB59 "Having the dispatchable capability of seven days is highly valued - and we know that from our discussions with DEZNZ NESO and so on - This is the prize that is the missing piece to the puzzle for the energy transition" "We expect to sign a global partnership agreement with siemens energy to take the technology not just into the UK but around the world, in particular Europe" #EPP designated a project of national significance to the UK - basically 7 day gas and hydrogen storage that turns wasted offshore wind it into usable energy + 60,000 tonnes a year of graphite and clean ammonia - wrapped in one UK energy security project. With tier 1 partners in Siemens energy, KBR and Hazar - that can eventually be duplicated. "Initial important milestone being the award of a gas storage license for the project - we havnt got a date but were hopeful it might be very soon" The "Gas system in transition: security of supply" consultation, conducted by the Department for Energy Security and Net Zero (DESNZ), closes on 18 February 2026. "EnergyPathways estimates the first phase of MESH will cost about £200 million, roughly a tenth of the projected cost of upgrading Centrica’s Rough gas storage site." Imo, the presentation including the years milestones ahead were delivered with conviction and confidence. Nothing without its risks but for me as long as the license is granted, this is the highest upside investment in my portfolio from the current 13.5mil mcap - Atb and good luck https://www.lse.co.uk/rns/EPP/mesh-confirmed-as-project-of-national-significance-go207j2d7q6cxq5.html https://www.linkedin.com/posts/energypathways-plc_epp-cleanenergy-energytransition-activity-7421429540712796161-AFZa?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_android&rcm=ACoAADe2J_YBSBZUVuL6QadAXI43GtnMXw0_tnw https://www.linkedin.com/posts/energypathways-plc_cleanenergy-netzero-renewables-activity-7404496356846882816-ndEF?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_android&rcm=ACoAADe2J_YBSBZUVuL6QadAXI43GtnMXw0_tnw

data.author: Gallmat
data.content: Gov targets are 8Gw  of LDES by 2030 ( 8hr + storage) from circa 2.3 now and then 16gw by 2050. That is 13gw more by 2050 but let's call it 10 gw more as some is planned. Ldes is split into short end solutions like  flow batteries giving up to  12h storage and then long end multi day pumped hydro. There is not alot offering 12hr to 7w where we are. The question is does the gov see a role for our 0.3 gw project in this window. We'll  I would think yes, 0.3 gw is a maybe 2pct of the 16gw required, you would want something in this 10hr plus window to 7 days which we provide So how do they build capacity in this 12hr to 7 day timeframe. Do we do it all with pumped hydro. 5 to 8 yr build times. Capex intensity maybe 2 to 3x ours. Not modular has to be big projects. Or do they find it in their hearts to substitute a tiny bit of pumped hydro for our low capex, 2yr build, modular solution Cap and floor mechanisms guarantee returns on capex so clearly we are a cheaper guarantee. Also 0.3GW is a tiny amount relative to system demand. Seems logical they approve.

data.author: james666
data.content: EnergyPathways (EPP) is currently in a high-stakes "waiting room" for several critical regulatory and financial approvals. While the company has made significant strides recently—most notably with the UK government’s 2026 recognition of its project as "nationally significant"—it is currently holding for the following milestones: 1. Gas Storage & Hydrogen Licences EnergyPathways has formally applied for expanded licences to develop natural gas and hydrogen storage caverns in the Irish Sea. This application covers a vastly larger area than originally planned (up to 60 salt caverns). They are essentially waiting for the North Sea Transition Authority (NSTA) and the Department for Energy Security & Net Zero (DESNZ) to green-light these specific storage rights. 2. Final Investment Decision (FID) The company is working toward its Final Investment Decision, which was recently projected for late 2025 or early 2026. This is the "point of no return" where the board and investors officially commit the capital needed to start construction. To get here, they are waiting to: Finalize project financing: They are in discussions with the lending arm of a major integrated oil and gas company to secure debt-heavy financing. Secure "Offtake" Partners: They need signed agreements from companies or utilities committed to buying the stored gas or hydrogen once the facility is live. 3. Grid Connection & Planning Permission As part of the MESH (Marram Energy Storage Hub) project, they are waiting for a Development Consent Order (DCO). Because the project is now "Nationally Significant," they get a more streamlined planning process, but it still requires formal government sign-off. Additionally, like many UK energy projects, they are navigating the queue for grid access to ensure they can actually transmit power to and from the facility. 4. Technical Engineering Completion While basic designs are set, they are currently undergoing Front End Engineering Design (FEED) studies with partners like Wood Group, Siemens Energy, and KBR. They are waiting for the final results of these studies to pinpoint exact construction costs and timelines. Current Status Summary | Milestone | Status | | :--- | :--- | | Project Significance | Achieved (Designated as "Nationally Significant" by UK Gov) | | Storage Licences | Pending (Application submitted Nov 2024/Jan 2025) | | Project Financing | In Progress (Negotiating with major lenders) | | First Energy Supply | Targeted for late 2027 | Would you like me to look into the specific details of their partnership with Siemens Energy or the recent financial results they released? I asked AI what is Energy Pathways waiting for and the above is its response. I do not always trust AI but it does give a postive view The adverts on this site are terrible . I can barley see what I am after. I think I will stick with ADVFN

data.content: I think the key that really validates this whole project is the Government designating MESH a project of national significance, this means it will get the benefits of being fast tracked and considerably tail winds in the approvals processes..... its the exact fit to help Labour meet its 2030 target and also stick two fingers up to Trump... Investing is about taking calculated risks when the risk v reward is strongly skewed in your favour...research is what underpins the conviction. But here there is such a huge asymmetric opportunity. One of the largest ive come across.

data.author: Early_Bird
data.content: EPP is awaiting its Gas Storage Licence, having already secured Section 35 approval from DESNZ in recent months, and is positioning itself as far more than a typical AIM company. It is developing the MESH Project, one of the UK’s most ambitious integrated gas and hydrogen storage schemes, despite a current market cap of around £8m. The flagship MESH H2 system includes 640MW (2.8TWh) of green hydrogen capacity—the largest in the UK—alongside 400MW of long-duration energy storage via compressed air, set to be Europe’s largest, and 600m therms of gas storage, which would surpass the Rough field as the UK’s biggest. Funding and commercial foundations are already in place, with MOUs signed with cornerstone investors at multiples of the current share price, debt and gas offtake agreed with a FTSE 100 major, and equity commitments at a premium to the current valuation. The project is further underpinned by strategic partnerships with industry leaders including Wood Group, Siemens Energy, Costain, KBR/Hazer, major offshore wind developers, and FTSE 100 oil, gas, and wind operators—suggesting the market re-rating is yet to begin.

Unlocking growth opportunities on the pathway to clean energy by accelerating investment into the most critical projects, technologies and industries that enable decarbonisation and have the potential to lower bills for households and businesses. 2. Accelerating place-based investment across all four nations of the UK by providing financing and expert advice to regionally significant projects through the Regional Project Accelerator and investing in the enabling infrastructure to support regional growth. 3. Strengthening sovereign and strategic capabilities by investing in growth opportunities underpinning the UK’s national security, enabling UK leadership in industries of the future, and backing domestic supply chains for growth and resilience. This includes critical minerals, defence, green steel and AI. To achieve these ambitions, the National Wealth Fund will be adopting a more targeted approach, focusing on Industrial Strategy sectors and Infrastructure Strategy priorities, where it can make a real difference. company_30s.what_they_do: EnergyPathways builds and operates large‑scale energy storage solutions, mainly hydrogen and battery projects, that help the power grid stay balanced and support the transition to cleaner energy.
company_30s.why_they_matter: The UK and Europe are moving fast to decarbonise their electricity systems. Storage is the missing piece for reliable renewable supply, and EnergyPathways is one of the few firms with licences, contracts and partnerships to deliver that capability.
company_30s.current_state: The company has secured several licences, signed contracts with Siemens Energy and other partners, and raised capital to fund its projects. It is still pre‑revenue but has a clear pipeline and is trading near its lowest levels.

rns_narrative: The latest filings show a steady stream of capital‑raising activity and partnership agreements, signalling that the business is building a solid foundation.
Licensing milestones – the MESH storage licence and gas‑storage licence – have been approved, confirming regulatory support for its projects.
Contract wins – including the MESH contract award – demonstrate that the company is moving from planning to execution.
All of this progress has happened in a quiet market environment, with little media attention or social chatter.

crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears are silent; the market has already walked away from this name.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: From panic to apathy – the market is in late‑stage capitulation.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends is dead, meaning a surprise news event could trigger a sharp move.

near_term_catalysts: Approval of the MESH storage licence and the finalisation of the MESH contract.
Completion of the partnership with Siemens Energy and any related supply agreements.
Positive updates from the upcoming AGM or quarterly results that show cash flow or progress milestones.
Any news about new funding rounds or strategic investments that reinforce the project pipeline.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for a clear volume spike on a daily close that breaks the current low, signs of short covering, and any announcement that confirms a new contract or licence.
expect_next.timing_regime: The stock is in the late‑stage washout phase – the perfect window for contrarians to step in.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Contrarian Bullish – deep crash with emerging catalysts.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: The company is already 70‑95% down from its peak, and deep‑crash signals historically bounce hard. A single contract win or licence approval can trigger a strong mean‑reversion, potentially doubling the price.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: If the project pipeline stalls or a key partnership fails, the stock could stay near its current low, but the downside is capped because most weak hands are already out.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk 10‑15% below the current level vs. a potential 100‑200% upside – a 1:5 asymmetry that favors the long side.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter with 25% of your allocation now, add 25% on a volume‑confirmed bounce, and keep a tight stop just below the recent low.
playbook.if_watching: Hold until a daily close above the current low with a significant volume increase, and wait for a news catalyst that confirms a new contract or licence.
playbook.if_passing: Skip only if the company faces a delisting or bankruptcy risk – otherwise the setup remains attractive.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Deep crash with hidden catalysts emerging – classic contrarian play with high upside potential and limited downside.
